messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Would you like some news from Switzerland ?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Why do you have to?  I m presuming you mean your extended family (parents, IL s, siblings, etc.)  I am liking the whole after the fact telling rather
messages.messageBody:
On 8/23/06, seccotine_ch <seccotine@...> wrote:

> (still have to tell my family about it, though, and don't look
> forward to it ...)
>

Why do you have to? I'm presuming you mean your extended family
(parents, IL's, siblings, etc.) I am liking the whole "after the
fact" telling rather than the announcing ahead of time. And with
positive attitudes!

--
Michelle
aka Melbrigða
http://eventualknitting.blogspot.com
MedHS@yahoogroups.com - Homeschooling for the Medieval Recreationist

messages.subject: Would you like some news from Switzerland ?
messages.msgSnippet: Well, it s gonna be short, because I haven t much time, but we are doing just fine !!! I haven t realised how much energy the canicule was draining out of me
messages.messageBody:
Well, it's gonna be short, because I haven't much time, but we are
doing just fine !!! I haven't realised how much energy the canicule
was draining out of me ... and I've become quite good in sharing
time with my kids.

I would like to thank you for all your good advice ... and for the
good spirit you have breathed on us ! I'm really amazed on the
freedom and energy unschooling has already given us ! And especially
me. I'm a kind of learning addict, I already knew that, but
something has changed - it has expanded in completely new areas,
such as parenting, for instance ;) Now, when I don't like the way I
am with the kids, I'm not feeling desperate nor a failure - I'm
like "All right, this is something I don't know yet, let's learn".
That's GREAT. I'm really feeling empowered.

Even if everything is not perfect, c'est la belle vie !

Sure, I'm here to stay. Thank you !

Helen in Geneva (don't I sound a bit extatic this morning ?)

(still have to tell my family about it, though, and don't look
forward to it ...)
